summary: The document is a classified communication concerning the proposed declassification and release of a BSS document from 1963, involving an interview with Mrs. Lillian Sloboda, under the President John F. Kennedy Assassination Records Act of 1992. The BSS opposes the release due to concerns over confidentiality and the personal nature of the content, while also questioning the document's relevance to the JFK assassination. The communication requests guidance on proceeding with the declassification and release in light of these objections.
key_findings: BSS opposes the release of a 1963 interview document with Mrs. Lillian Sloboda, citing confidentiality and personal content concerns.
The relevance of the document to the JFK assassination is unclear, with no direct connection identified beyond the coinciding time frame.
Seeking guidance on how to proceed with the declassification and release process, considering the BSS's objections and the document's questionable relevance.
